conclusion: Solve step-by-step problem about blocks' motion and collision
Block b is initially pulled to height h = 1.25m and released from rest, swings as a pendulum and collides with block a at the lowest point
Initial potential energy of b: E_{p,initial} = 25g J
Final kinetic energy of b: E_{k,final} = 25g J
Velocity of block b just before collision: v_b = 5 m/s
Collision is elastic and head-on, blocks have equal mass, they exchange velocities
Velocity of block a after collision: v_0 = 5 m/s
AB is frictionless and horizontal
Block a maintains v_0 = 5 m/s along AB
On conveyor belt MN, block a is subject to belt's motion v = 2 m/s to the left and frictional force F_f = 10g N
Acceleration due to friction: a_f = 5 m/s²
Initial relative velocity of block a with respect to the belt: v_{rel,initial} = 7 m/s
Time for friction to bring block to rest relative to the belt: t = 1.4 s
Distance traveled on MN while decelerating: d = 4.9 m
MN is only 1m long, block doesn't come to rest relative to the belt before reaching N
Relative velocity after traveling 1m on MN: v_{rel,final} = 6.245 m/s
Block a enters CD with velocity about 6.245 m/s relative to the belt
Absolute velocity on CD: v_{CD,initial} = 4.245 m/s to the right
Acceleration on CD: a_f = 5 m/s²
Time to travel along CD: t_{CD} ≈ 0.849 s
Distance traveled during time on CD: d_{CD} = 1.802 m
CD is only 1m long, block won't come to rest on CD
